alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 8:25PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN... RICHMOND...SOUTH CENTRAL WESTMORELAND AND SOUTHEASTERN ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM EDT... At 825 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Millers Tavern, or near Saint Stephens Church, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Millers Tavern around 830 PM EDT. Tappahannock around 845 PM EDT. Dunnsville around 850 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Upright, Ino, Biscoe, Tidewater, Lyells, Crouch, Kennard, Mount Landing, Piney Grove, and Dunbrooke. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland
